meanings.definition: A sudden and extreme emotional reaction, typically characterized by panic or hysteria.
meanings.sent1: Her freakouts always involve lots of screaming and crying.
meanings.sent2: His frequent freakouts make it hard for others to stay calm.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor's fake freakouts had the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm outside seemed to mimic the chaos of her internal freakouts.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's fear of spiders led to daily freakouts that echoed through the house.

meanings.definition: To have a sudden and extreme emotional reaction, typically characterized by panic or hysteria.
meanings.sent1: She tends to freak out whenever she sees a spider.
meanings.sent2: Don't freak out, everything will be okay in the end.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to freak out at the sight of the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: His heart would freak out every time he had to speak in public.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected noise made her freak out and drop her phone.
